tasks.task: Assessing pond construction site and planning
subtasks: Identifying the future pond location within a watershed
Considering soil quality for dam construction (amount to move, compaction, water retention)
Evaluating watershed features for optimal dam formation (natural pinch points, shortest distance for water containment)
Analyzing watershed vegetation's impact on sediment and nutrient control (prairie benefits, reduced aquatic plant growth)
Designing dam slope for fish habitat and vegetation control (three to one slope, promoting plants near edge, preventing growth offshore)
Evaluating current watershed elements for habitat improvement (removing trees for fish congregation areas)

tasks.task: Contacting extension specialist for further questions
subtasks: Seeking additional advice or clarification from fisheries and aquaculture extension specialist

tasks.task: First, the person, Alan Patilla, is an extension specialist from Iowa State University. He's talking about site selection and construction. The main task would be assessing the site and planning the pond. That's the MAINTASK.
MAINTASK: Assessing pond construction site and planning

Considering soil quality for dam construction (amount to move, compaction, water retention)
Evaluating watershed features for optimal dam formation (natural pinch points, shortest distance for water containment)
Analyzing watershed vegetation's impact on sediment and nutrient control (prairie benefits, reduced aquatic plant growth)
Designing dam slope for fish habitat and vegetation control (three to one slope, promoting plants near edge, preventing growth offshore)
Evaluating current watershed elements for habitat improvement (removing trees for fish congregation areas)
